stepTitle: To find the inverse of f(x) where $$a=2$$ (remember that a is equal to the x-value of a point), then we need to first find what value of $$x$$ when we plug it into f(x) will give us a value of $$2$$. In this case, it is when $$x=1$$, so we know that $$g(2)=1$$ where g(x) is the inverse of f(x).
